conclusion: Determine if the puppy is safe by calculating the total distance the bus travels until it stops.
Break down the distance calculation into reaction time and deceleration phase.
During reaction time of 0.5 seconds, bus travels at initial speed of 20 m/s.
Distance during reaction time is 10 m.
Velocity-time graph shows bus decelerates uniformly from 20 m/s to 0 m/s over 4.5 seconds.
Area under velocity-time graph represents distance traveled.
Graph consists of a rectangle (reaction time) and a triangle (deceleration).
Base of triangle is time interval from 0.5 s to 5 s, which is 4.5 s.
Height of triangle is change in velocity from 20 m/s to 0 m/s.
Area of triangle (distance during deceleration) is 45 m.
Total distance traveled by bus is 55 m.
Bus travels 55 m before stopping, puppy is initially 45 m away, so puppy is not safe.
